*Acceptance Criteria*
A/C #1 - Avatar upload
GIVEN User uploads a image
WHEN Image format is jpeg. 
THEN avatar image is updated and success message is shown

A/C #2 - Avatar upload (validation)
GIVEN User uploads a image
WHEN Image format is not jpeg. 
THEN Show error message, avatar upload not successful image to the user
 
A/C #3 - Avatar delete
GIVEN User deletes avatar image
THEN Show message that avatar was successfully deleted

 
+*Technical:*+

*_Upload:_*

 {code:java}
POST /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

Body:
multipart/form-data -> file
key: avatar
value: {file.jpeg}
Content-Type: image/jpeg  {code}
 

_Note: Allow upload only jpeg files._

*_Delete_*
{code:java}
DELETE /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}
{code}
 

+*List of possible validation errors*+
{code:java}
MISSING_MULTIPART_DATA
TOO_MANY_FILES
IMAGE_NAME_MUST_BE_AVATAR
IMAGE_FORMAT_ONLY_JPEG
IMAGE_INVALID_DATA
MISSING_IDS_NAME
USER_IS_INACTIVE
INVALID_USER {code}
 

+*_Format of error messages:_*+
{code:java}
{
  "details": "MISSING_IDS_NAME",
  "traceId": "68ef62a078ee7381e0d5b52c9723c4fd"
} {code}

Focus on:
 * Code clean up
 * Better state management

Profile team has implemented feature to upload IDS Avatar Image. SAM backend should integrate with profile API to upload and delete avatar image, also SAM backend should expose endpoints secured by access_token to upload and delete avatar image. 

Avatar implementation is documented here > [https://aDomain/wiki/x/40sEQgE]
 * Url generation logic with salt is implemented as part of UIDX-6313, refactore the code so *avatar-owner i.e* the unique IDS image value generation is one place. 
 * Validate the file format is jpg. On error, return http status 400 (Bad request)

 * If the profile api is down. Return status 500, try again later. **

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
A/C #1 - Avatar upload
GIVEN user uploads a  image
WHEN Image format is jpeg. 
THEN call profile endpoint to save the image. Return http status 200 & image url you receive from profile api. 

 

A/C #2 - Avatar upload
GIVEN user uploads a image
WHEN Image format is not jpeg. 
THEN  Return http status 400, with appropriate error status. 

 

A/C #3 - Avatar delete
GIVEN user deletes image
THEN call profile endpoint to delete the image. Return http status 204. 

 

A/C #4 - Avatar api is down
GIVEN user upload or delete image
WHEN profile api is down. 
THEN return 500. 

Note: not possible to simulate for testing we are not owners of avatar api.

 

A/C #5 - Avatar api returns error
GIVEN user upload or delete image
WHEN profile api return error
THEN forward response to user

 

A/C #6 - Avatar api returns error
GIVEN user upload image with size bigger than 5 MB
THEN returns error HTTP 413

IMAGE_FORMAT_ONLY_JPEG

*As a* SAM user, *I want to have* separate avatars for different IDS identities *so that I* can manage better my linked accounts and switch easily between accounts

 

*Background*

To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. Post UID removal as IDP, user will need to be able to assign avatars on different IDS identity linked to UID. This story is about introducing such ability in SAM. 

Note the existing UID Avatar is not affected, it's still fetched from the profile.sap.com and the related APIs - see [wiki|https://aDomain/wiki/display/ONEPROFILE/Avatar+API]

*Technical Details*
 * This story is about preparing the FE & UX part required for UIDX-4705

 

*Note -* we aim to replicate the functional behaviour that is present on profile.sap.com, please check out how it works there currently

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * IDS account avatars can be hidden via feature toggle 
 * -Upon selecting an identity in the Identity table, user can view the existing avatar in the details section on the right-
 ** -If no avatar has been uploaded for that identity, user see default picture. Note: profile service provides picture in all cases even default one.-
 * Upon clicking Edit Avatar icon, users can browse for new avatar picture and then upload it
 ** Supported file formats - JPG , (?) PNG
 ** File max size limitation
 * Delete option is supported
 * Option to resize and crop the picture on screen is supported (see profile.sap.com)
 * Show success message or error upon new avatar upload
